alert.note: Alert for Morrill (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 30 at 9:03PM CDT until July 30 at 9:30PM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM MDT FOR EASTERN BOX BUTTE...NORTHEASTERN MORRILL AND SOUTHEASTERN DAWES COUNTIES... At 803 PM MDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 9 miles east of Box Butte Dam to near Wild Horse Butte to near Alliance Airport, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Alliance, Wild Horse Butte, Box Butte Campground, Berea, Alliance Airport and Box Butte Dam. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare immediately for large hail and damaging winds. People outside should move to a shelter, inside a strong building and away from windows. To report severe weather contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Cheyenne.
